intro: Debregeasia saeneb, commonly known as the Ethiopian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
